comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I think his address was Castle Lane, which has disappeared since. In the 1911 census, there are two well-to-do Stephenson families in the area, one around the corner on Castle Street, and the other nearby on New street. If this lad is just 3 here, he might be Richard Henry, son of a doctor/surgeon, or Thomas P., son of a solicitor. In 1901, both families lived next door to each other in New Street, and the Dr. Stephenson had an older son, Francis, too, who would have been 11 when this photo was taken (too old). To confuse matters, here is another nli photo of Stephenson children in Carrick, but it looks more like girls than boys (I know, hard to tell sometimes, but bows in her hair?). Aha, looking at both censusseses, I see that by 1911, Kathleen has 7 children, six living. In 1901, they had 3 daughters living with them, and in 1911, three sons. Maybe the three children are Kathleen's 3 girls, Constance, Ethel and Maria, or some combination of her boys and girls, or just a mess of cousins.
